- MacOS: https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/8a7f7bf3df09fa352979b1b92b3eea99fc802bce41f4349cfdeb3f25792233ce/detection
- Linux-AMD64: https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/de2961c3d4c0a00ce565989721d25b3abcf1e9e70b511c5cdb4e343005b13cc4/detection
- Windows: https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/74bbe68954498821f079a9a611cf6b8b8f8deb10f9a6e2feb594deba5c5ed7b1/detection

Why may Avast and Kaspersky flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because it includes mining software, which can be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. These warnings are false positives.

What is the importance of upgrading to the new Verus software by December 15th?

Upgrading to the new Verus software by December 15th is mandatory to remain on the Verus mainnet. The Verus mainnet protocol will hardfork at block 800200, and failing to upgrade may require resynchronizing the blockchain if you are running in native mode.
